review: This is our second Fire TV. We loved the first one so much we got one for the other TV so we could watch movies, TV shows, and play games upstairs. We've downloaded all our apps including Hulu and Netflix. The one or two things you can't get immediately, you can still watch on cable but it's much cheaper to buy individual seasons than to pay for cable. All you have to do is switch the input. Just make sure you buy the HDMI cable to hook it up to the TV.

review: I've had Fire TV for about a week and have been happy so far.  Received it as an Xmas present and am using it to replace my Roku XS.  Some Pros and Cons of Fire TV:Pros-Voice search works pretty well and is much more convenient compared to spelling out your search-YouTube app is much faster than on the Roku.  The processing power of Fire TV shows that its a big difference- Gaming is actually pretty fun, even without the controller.  It would be great if someone made a emulator app for the Fire.- Fit and finish of the box and remote are both top notch.Cons- Still not as many channels compared to Roku- Movie search only brings up Amazon selectionsOverall, I'm really pleased with Fire TV.  If you are already heavy into Amazon eco system, definitely pick one up.
